Liberty is not an absolute, it's a goal. Libertarianism isn't really an ideology either. Libertarians want (or should want) the greatest amount of personal freedom possible without resorting to official anarchy. Since there is no way to tell how much freedom there can be in any social system until we try it out in the real world, it's more of an experiment than a plan. The US Constitution was such an experiment, and history tells us how it worked out ... its strengths and weaknesses. All most of us know at this point in history is that personal freedom and responsibility formally are about as low as they've been since the Constitution was ratified.

I don't think asburgers had much of a role in this as she tries to explain his behavior. Let's call evil for what it is. It wasn't random, he seeked out Christians in a terroristic manner, trying to instill fear in the hearts of all who witnessed it, hoping to deter people from claiming God or seeking God. God clearly states to fear no man, and we should not deny him. The guns are not the problem. You could own a hundred and not kill anyone. It's the operation behind the intent. This is nothing new. The beginning of mass shootings targeting Christians began back at Columbine. Praise God for those who bravely are willing to stand up in the face of evil to declare God as their Lord and take the death penalty! There's much to be said, if people are willing to die professing their faith. Whoever hasn't put their faith in Christ who has been spared even without a situation so extreme but has been given another day...I encourage you to do so! ROMANS 3 20-31 ACTS 16:31 ISAIAH 53
